snippet: The law, championed by Gov. Rick Perry, bans abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy and requires abortion clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.
abstract: Texas Gov Rick Perry signs new abortion bill into law giving state some of toughest restriction in country, even as women's rights advocates vow to challenge law's legality in court.

byline.contributor: Erik Eckholm contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The law, championed by Gov. Rick Perry, bans abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy and requires abortion clinics to meet the same standards as hospital-style surgical centers.

headline.main: Abortion Restrictions Become Law in Texas, but Opponents Will Press Fight
headline.print_headline: Abortion Restrictions Become Law in Texas, but Opponents Will Press Fight
